title: National Heritage Conservation Commission (Musonda Falls) (National Monument) (Declaration) Order, 2023
content:
17th August, 2023 Statutory Instruments 201
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 31 of 2023
The National Heritage Conservation Commission Act
(Laws, Volume 12, Cap 173)
The National Heritage Conservation Commission
(Musonda Falls) (National Monument) (Declaration)
Order, 2023
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 27 of the National
Heritage Conservation Commission Act, the following Order is
made:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Heritage Title
Conservation Commission (Musonda Falls) (National Monument)
(Declaration) Order, 2023.
2. The heritage described in the Schedule is declared a national Declaration
of national
monument. monument
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O.Box 30136, 10101 Lusaka Price K4.00 each
202 Statutory Instruments 17th August, 2023
SCHEDULE
(Paragraph 2)
MUSONDA FALLS
LOCATION
The site is located at latitude -10.714746°S and longitude 28.812707°E
(10°42’53.1’’S, 28°48’45.8’’E) in Luapula Province on the Luombe River in
Mwense District.
STATEMENT OF SIGNIFICANCE
The site is formed over metamorphosed sediments which have turned into
shales and slate, composed of a series of cascading waterfall islands with a
number of palm trees and an island system depicting both a youthful and mature
stage of river within a very short distance. The site is ideal as an open-air
laboratory for endemic botanical aloe species.
BOUNDARY DESCRIPTION
The boundary of the site runs from Point A on the northern bank of the
Luombe River and follows the northern bank from Point B, C, D to Point E;
thence in an easterly direction to Point F; thence in a south-easterly direction to
Point G, before the power station crosses the Luongo River at Point H extending
to Point I on the banks of the Luombe River; thence in a south-easterly direction
to Points J, K and L; thence to Point M in a south-westerly orientation; thence
further to Point N; thence in a north-westerly direction to Point O; thence
crosses the Luombe River at Point P and connects to Point Q on the bank of the
Luombe river before meeting the starting Point A besides the bridge; thence in a
southerly direction to Point D before connecting to Point E in a south-westerly
direction and then in a northerly direction to Point F truncating the Luombe
River. The site has a total area of 3.2 square kilometres.
The described area is in extent of a total area of 320 hectares.
The described area is shown on a plan marked red, signed by the Surveyor-
General and deposited in the office of the Surveyor-General and the National
Heritage Conservation Commission, Lusaka.
R. SIKUMBA,
LUSAKA Minister of Tourism
11th August, 2023
[MOT.13/7/1]
